qas.question: What is the percentage of binder in mastic asphalt?
How much additional binder does rolled asphalt concrete have?
How is asphalt used in the construction industry?
Prior to spreading, how hot is mastic asphalt heated?
What is the usual thickness of the mastic spread on roofs?
What percentage of concrete is in mastic asphalt?
What is a type of impervious barrier that differs from dense graded asphalt?

plausible_answers.text: it has a higher asphalt/bitumen (binder) content

qas.question: Mastic asphalt is the same as dense graded asphalt because why?
Rolled asphalt concrete has contains around 7% what?
What is widely used in buildings for making asphalt waterproof?

context: <b6_0>Mastic asphalt<b6_0/> is a type of asphalt which differs from dense graded asphalt (asphalt concrete) in that <b7_0>it has a higher asphalt/bitumen (binder) content<b7_0/>, usually around <a0_0><b5_0>7–10%<b5_0/><a0_0/> of the whole aggregate mix, as opposed to rolled asphalt concrete, which has only around <a1_0>5%<a1_0/> <b8_0>added asphalt/bitumen<b8_0/>. This <b9_0>thermoplastic substance<b9_0/> is widely used in the building industry for <a2_0>waterproofing<a2_0/> flat roofs and tanking underground. Mastic asphalt is heated to a temperature of <a3_0>210 °C<a3_0/> (410 °F) and is spread in layers to form an impervious barrier about <a4_0>20 millimeters<a4_0/> (0.79 inches) thick.
